recipe.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipe.description: A classic Indian dish made with marinated chicken in a creamy tomato sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, cayenne, black pepper, ginger, and garlic. Stir to coat the chicken evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers and place them on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.

Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine the tomato sauce and cream. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and stir to coat. Simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until heated through.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

recipe.name: Palak Paneer
recipe.description: A popular vegetarian dish made with spinach and paneer cheese in a creamy tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Wash the spinach thoroughly and blanch in boiling water for 1-2 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process. Puree the spinach in a blender or food processor and set aside.
In a large pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, green chili pepper, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and garam masala. Cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the pureed spinach and cream. Stir to combine and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the paneer cheese cubes and cook for another 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is heated through and the sauce has thickened to your liking.
Season with salt to taste and serve with rice or naan bread.

recipe.name: Chicken Korma
recipe.description: A mildly spiced Indian dish made with tender chicken in a rich and creamy yogurt-based sauce.
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the yogurt and lemon juice. Add the chicken pieces and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
In a large pan, heat the oil and ghee over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened and golden, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, and green chili peppers. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and nutmeg. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the marinated chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the water and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened to your liking.
Season with salt to taste and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with rice or naan bread.

recipe.name: Pad Thai
recipe.description: A popular Thai stir-fried noodle dish with sweet, sour, and savory flavors.
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in hot water for 8-10 minutes, or until softened. Drain and set aside.
In a wok or large pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and shallots, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the shrimp and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until pink and cooked through.
Push the shrimp to one side of the pan and add the beaten eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until set, then stir them into the shrimp mixture.
Add the rice noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the noodles are coated in the sauce and heated through.
Add the bean sprouts, scallions, peanuts, and cilantro. Toss everything together and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot with lime wedges on the side.

recipe.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipe.description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pecorino romano cheese, and guanciale or pancetta.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
While the spaghetti is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced guanciale or pancetta and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated pecorino romano cheese, minced garlic, black pepper, and chopped parsley.

When the spaghetti is done, reserve 1 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the crispy guanciale or pancetta. Toss everything together over low heat for 1-2 minutes.

Remove the skillet from the heat and pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly to coat the spaghetti evenly. The heat from the spaghetti and guanciale or pancetta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
If the pasta seems too dry, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water a little at a time to loosen it up.
Serve hot with additional grated pecorino romano cheese and black pepper, if desired.

recipe.name: Chicken Enchiladas
recipe.description: A delicious Mexican dish made with shredded chicken, corn tortillas, and red enchilada sauce.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded chicken, 1 cup of the red enchilada sauce, and salt to taste.
Warm the corn tortillas in the microwave or on a skillet until they are soft and pliable.
Fill each tortilla with the chicken mixture and roll it up. Place the rolled enchiladas seam-side down in a baking dish.
Pour the remaining red enchilada sauce over the enchiladas, making sure they are all covered.
Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top of the enchiladas.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.

recipe.name: Chicken Teriyaki
recipe.description: A popular Japanese dish made with grilled chicken glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce.
ingredients: Sesame seeds and sliced green onions for garnish
instructions: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken thighs to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 6-8 minutes per side.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water to make a slurry. Stir the slurry into the teriyaki sauce and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has further thickened.
Garnish the chicken with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
